sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"方面"之意。
means: phase ： 指可以对事物进行观察或描述或考虑的任何方面。
aspect ： 着重以特定观点对事物进行观察或考虑。
side可与aspect和phase换用，但更着重构成事物全貌的一个或多个方面。
angle ： 专指从某一角度去观察、考虑事物的某个方面。

word_mean: 期，相：疾病或过程所经历的各个方面或阶段
相：在物理化学上，指在某个系统中理化性质独特、均质而又可被机械地分开的部分，如水的冰相和蒸汽相
相位板，phase-plate 在玻璃平板或透镜上的局部区域内(通常是环带)，镀上一层具有一定厚度和折射率的膜层，使透过该区域的光比通过非镀层区的光相位超前或滞后。
相位移，phase-shift 波传播过程中引起的相位改变。周期变化信号或波动的相对位置。
相衬显微镜，phase-contrast micro-scope 为相衬显微术专门设计或附加配备装置的显微镜。
相调连接，phase-adjustable connector 在电路中用以调节负载相位的连接器。
锁相激光器，phase-locking laser热力学中指系统内物理性质均匀的部分。
相位，在交变或周期性变化的物理量的图形上，各点相对于周期起点的位置。

sentence.Network_en: The phase of writing that is actually most important is revision.
sentence.Network_cn: 实际上写作过程中最重要的阶段是修改。

sentence.Network_en: The crisis is entering a crucial, critical phase.
sentence.Network_cn: 目前危机正进入决定性的关键阶段。

sentence.Network_en: The carrier wave has got out of phase with the signal wave.
sentence.Network_cn: 载波同信号波是异相的.

jx.jx_en_mean: To introduce, one stage at a time.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 分阶段引介：一阶段一个地引入

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring or come to an end, one stage at a time.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 逐步撤除：一次一个阶段地结束

jx.jx_en_mean: being or happening in (or out of) synchrony or harmony
jx.jx_cn_mean: （不）同相的（地）；（不）同步的（地）；（不）协调的（地）

lj.lj_ly: the cabling work should be carried out &B{in phase with} the building work.
lj.lj_ls: 电缆工程应当与建筑工程同步进行。

jx.jx_en_mean: In a correlated or synchronized way.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 按阶段：用相关的或同步的方式

jx.jx_en_mean: In an unsynchronized or uncorrelated way.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不分阶段：用不同步的或不相关的方式

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (denoting each aspect of the moon): from French phase, based on Greek phasis 'appearance', from the base of phainein 'to show'

entry.def: A phase is a particular stage in a process or in the gradual development of something.

example.ex: This autumn, 6000 residents will participate in the first phase of the project...
example.tran: 今年秋天，将有6000名居民参加该项目的第一阶段。

example.ex: The crisis is entering a crucial, critical phase...
example.tran: 目前危机正进入决定性的关键阶段。

entry.def: If an action or change is phased over a period of time, it is done in stages.

example.ex: The redundancies will be phased over two years.
example.tran: 裁员将在两年内分阶段进行。

example.ex: ...a phased withdrawal of American forces from the Philippines.
example.tran: 美国从菲律宾的分阶段撤军

entry.tran: 不同步的（地）/同步的（地）；不协调的（地）/协调的（地）
entry.def: If two things are out of phase with each other, they are not working or happening together as they should. If two things are in phase, they are working or occurring together as they should.

example.ex: The Skills Programme is out of phase with the rest of the curriculum.
example.tran: 技能课程与其他课程不协调。

example.ex: ...uncomfortable jet-lag symptoms of indigestion and out-of-phase sleeping and waking.
example.tran: 消化不良、睡眠时间混乱等不舒服的飞行时差症状

means.word_mean: 1. (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system; matter that is identical in chemical composition and physical state and separated from other material by the phase boundary;

sentences.sentence: "the reaction occurs in the liquid phase of the system"

means.word_mean: 2. any distinct time period in a sequence of events;

sentences.sentence: "we are in a transitional stage in which many former ideas must be revised or rejected"

means.word_mean: 3. a particular point in the time of a cycle; measured from some arbitrary zero and expressed as an angle
4. (astronomy) the particular appearance of a body's state of illumination (especially one of the recurring shapes of the part of Earth's moon that is illuminated by the sun);
2. adjust so as to be in a synchronized condition;

sentences.sentence: "he phased the intake with the output of the machine"

auth_sentence.content: Two companies proceeded to the second phase of testing.
auth_sentence.res_content: Two companies proceeded to the second phase of testing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Two companies proceeded to the second phase of testing.

auth_sentence.content: The benefits phase out as they begin to work.
auth_sentence.res_content: The benefits phase out as they begin to work.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The benefits phase out as they begin to work.

auth_sentence.content: Phase one's London-Birmingham link has faced considerable opposition.
auth_sentence.res_content: Phase one's London-Birmingham link has faced considerable opposition.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Phase one's London-Birmingham link has faced considerable opposition.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 语势强的, 用力的, 显著的, 断然的
stems_affixes.word_buile: em进入+pha=phas外貌,状态,显示+tic表形容词→进入状态的→用力的, 显著的
emphatic用力的+ally表副词→adv.强调地, 用力地
em进入+phas外貌,状态,显示+is→进入状态→强调
phas外貌,状态,显示+e→定相→相位→ 阶段；方面
em进入+phas外貌,状态,显示+ize……化→进入状态→强调，着重
phas外貌,状态,显示+e→定相→相位→ 阶段；方面

Sentence.sentence: Iowa's Waldorf College has graduated several hundred students in its three-year degree program, but it now phasing out the option.

sentences.en: It was a very important phase of history.
sentences.cn: 它是一个非常重要的历史阶段。

sentences.en: The phases of the moon include the new and the full moon.
The modernization of the industry was phased over at 20-year period.
sentences.cn: 工业现代化分20年逐步实现。

jushi.english: The phases of the moon include the new and the full moon.
It was a very important phase of history.
jushi.chinese: 它是一个非常重要的历史阶段。

jushi.english: There was a new dangerous phase between each other.
jushi.chinese: 双方的关系进入到一种危险的状态。
